quotes.quote: Quick believers need broad shoulders.
The believer is happy. The doubter is wise.
For the believer, nothing is impossible. We put limitations on ourselves.
A true believer does not fear physical death, rather he fears the death of his heart.
As believers, we all have the responsibility to leverage our wealth for kingdom purposes.
Believer's should never deal with doubts and fears because they are the devil's narcotics.
Believers are never told to become one; we already are one and are expected to act like it.
A believer is a bird in a cage, a freethinker is an eagle parting the clouds with tireless wing.
Believers are each other's mirrors.
Shallow believers prefer a shallow God.
Even true believers had consciences, too bad.
Only the believers pick up the prizes in life.
It is comfort to the believer that all things are possible.
The believer does not use God's power; God's power uses him.
The true believer is rewarded in every thing, even in affliction.
The believer who has never doubted will hardly convert a doubter.
Believers in political faith-healing enjoy a supreme immunity from doubt.
To believers, the bible is a holy book, to unbelievers, it is a story book.
The cosmic believer needs the energy of the universe to survive spiritually.
The true believer can no more live without prayer, than without food day by day.
As believers in Jesus Christ, our work is to believe while God works on our behalf.
As believers, you don't need to pray for a new heart, you need to pray for a new head.
If you are a believer in Christ, then you were predestined in eternity yet called in time.
The believer who feels the agony caused by rebellion will grow to become the best intercessor.
The self-assured believer is a greater sinner in the eyes of God than the troubled disbeliever.
A believer to another believer is like two hands, one washes the other (correcting each other).
To be a 'believer' does not make you superior to others; but to be a 'humanist' does make it so!
Why is a believer patient? Because he looks for the coming of the Lord...He waits quietly for the King.
The present time of believers is no longer determined by the past. It takes its definition from the future.
The challenge of the believer is to take the faith that you got in here and take it to the place out there.
The true believer, no matter how rowdy and violent his acts, is basically an obedient and submissive person.
Every believer is God's miracle.
No believer lives a spiritually isolated life.
Every believer is a witness whether he wants to be or not.
Every believer is commanded to be plugged in to a local church.
Any believer who has not encountered the Cross is not yet a follower of Christ.
Believers in the doctrines of modern Christendom will reap damnation to their souls.
To a true believer, death is but going to church: from the church below to the church above.
But a faithful believer will in all circumstances mediate on the mercy and fatherly goodness of God.
Some believers tend to forget God's persistent faithfulness in the face of the spectacular and showy.
Individual believers are not to usurp the role of civil government and judge people who are offensive.
As believers we have no need to fear death. Christ himself assures us of a safe arrival home in heaven!
Believers may come from different cultures, countries, or customs, but we serve one God who unites us all.
If you are a believer you are not supposed to begin to convince God to use you. God already desires to use you.
